intro: Oxycoccoides japonicus, commonly known as the Japanese oxycocco, is a rare shrub native to Japan. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern.
